comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: It is possible to play without KYC, but it might get more complicated for you since most of the reputable casinos will ask you to provide your personal details and documents when you want to withdraw larger amounts. If you google KYC free casino, you will see a lot of results. However, since gambling has become so regulated in many parts of the world, it is not as easy as it once was to find a site that allows you to sign up without having to complete the KYC process. It used to be pretty common for some crypto sites to accept people from all over the world without having to go through that process, but those days are gone.As Don Pedro Dinero already mentioned, there is a thread by Mahdirakib where you can find basic information about the KYC requirements of most of the casinos promoted here: Information of Crypto Casinos License and KYC requirements, but I would still confirm that information with customer support before depositing funds at any of the listed casinos.
